in Turkey, returned to the U.S. to have a lesion surgically removed from his right leg, spurring rumors he will retire. Allen Iverson denies this, as he wrote on his Twitter account: I have never said anything about retirement, nor have I said goodbye to the game of basketball. Once I get past this, my plan is to continue playing at the highest level possible. So don't put me in my rocking chair just yet. Hold on, I'll be back! It's not yet known if the lesion is benign or not, or if it's a cyst. Allen Iverson , 35, is expected to be out for several weeks

streamlining" effort rather than a management shake-up. "We've been talking about how best to simplify our management structure and speed up decision making for a long time," said Eric Schmidt . By clarifying our individual roles we'll create clearer responsibility and accountability at the top of the company. The move comes after Eric Schmidt spent some ten years as Google's top executive. "I made a comment like "Thank you' or something, and President Bush looked me in the eye and said,` You better take this seriously," the former Pentagon chief recalled. And of course, I did take it seriously. But I was also realistic that there was not much one could do about that. The television appearance was part of Donald Rumsfeld "s effort to promote his new memoir, "Known and Unkown," which was recounts his long government career serving Republican presidents from Richard Nixon to President Bush .

As the Financial Crisis Inquiry Commission just reported, the Fed "was a pivotal failure" at stemming "the flow of toxic mortgages." Moreover, the report concludes the Federal Reserve "neglected" its mission to ensure the safety and soundness of the nation's banking system and to "protect the credit rights of consumers."
